Subject: The Amazing Transparent Man
Description: 'The Amazing Transparent Man' Dr. Peter Ulof, inventor of an invisibility machine, is forced to create a weapon out of it by Maj. Paul Krenner who keeps his daughter prisoner. The machine cannot be completed without materials that are kept safe in a well guarded government facility. Krenner’s plan is to send an invisible man to steel the needed materials but he picks the wrong person for the job — a prisoner!  Speakers include:

Subject: Webseries and Fan Films: Future of Filmmaking?
Description: Come join us for a discussion on making webseries and fan films.  Speakers include:Keith Martens, Mary Lynne Gibbs, James Fernandez

Subject: Horrors of Spider Island
Description: 'Horrors of Spider Island' Gary and a group of dancers are flying to Singapore where they’ll perform. The plane crashes in the ocean and Gary and the girls are the only survivors. They barely make it to an island where they find fresh water, and something else…  Speakers include:

Subject: Rocky Horror Picture Show - The Preshow
Description: Spend an hour in an.ti.ci.....pation. Enjoy some fan videos and get ready to watch the feature film!  Speakers include:Tim Downing

Subject: Rocky Horror Picture Show
Description: 'The Rocky Horror Picture Show' Come join us for a strange journey...   Speakers include:Tim Downing

Subject: BoF: SciFi Movies and Technology
Description: Which scifi movies have you seen recently?  Which ones have technologies we will be seeing soon?  What technologies do you want to see next?  Speakers include:

Subject: A Horrible Sing-A-Long
Description: 'The status is not quo.' 45 minutes of watching and singing along to “Dr. Horrible’s Sing-A-Long Blog.' Costumes welcome!  Speakers include:Shannon Marshall, Maggie Maiville, Caitlynn Poirier

Subject: BoF: RHPS
Description: You've watched the movie and done the dance. Now... discuss!   Speakers include:

Subject: Midnight Monster Movies with Dr. Bob Presents...""
Description: Dr. Bob Tesla brings his show to PenguiCon! With the help of his lab assistants and his brother, Nikola, Dr. Bob brings you a fun, cheesy movie experience!  Speakers include:Robert Gilbert, Melanie Gilbert, Christopher Shea Massie, Christina Alia Massie, Paul Gilliland

Subject: Independent Film Block
Description: A collection of Michigan-Made Movies. Shorts and Features to include: 'Handlebar' a crime drama by Michael McCallum (Feature); 'Captive of a Death Mask' a slasher flick by Slash Proof Productions (Feature); 'Footprints' an apocalyptic short film by Slash Proof Productions (Short); 'Detroit Ghost Busters' a fan-film by Kimberly Howard (short); 'Crosscurrent' a DieselPunk film by Bad Catholic Films (short); 'Moving Mountains' a WWII drama by Michigami Films (short); 'Amish Vengence' a movie trailer parody by Bad Catholic Films. And maybe more!  Speakers include:

Subject: Filmmaker's Forum
Description: Open forum for Q&A about filmmaking. Learn how to get started in filmmaking.  Speakers include:Keith Martens, James Fernandez

Subject: Mystery Spatula Theatre 11
Description: Mystery Spatula Theater 11, or MST11 for short, is our own fan version of the popular television show Mystery Science Theater 3000. Although more fromage than homage, the MST11 crew still have fun doing what the 'big boys' do.  Speakers include:Matthew Duhan

Subject: Silent Era Movies
Description: The science fiction and horror form of movie goes all the way back to the initial days of cinema. Many people know about the big names like Nosferatu and Metropolis, but there are many more movies of significant interest and profound cultural importance to the geek community. This session will explore the common and easily (re)discovered movies from the silent era. Some excerpts (or a whole movie or two) will be shown.   Speakers include:

Subject: Film Roast
Description:
Go to the movies with Dawn and Greg as they add their own special brand of color commentary (a la MST3K ) to make a bad movie into a good laugh.   

WARNING: May (OK, WILL) include severe laughter, adult language and off-color jokes.  Not appropriate for young children or those who are easily offended,  Ask your doctor if your heart is healthy enough for sex-  if it's not, it probably won't get you through one of our shows, either.  Speakers include:Greg Williams, Dawn Kuczwara

Subject: The Smithee Awards
Description: In short, the Smithee Awards are like the Anti-people's Choice Awards. In long, they are an awards ceremony where 95 clips compete against each other (19 classic B-Movie categories, 5 clips per category) for the dubious honor of being the worst of the lot. Stupid Looking Monsters? Worst Science? Bad Acting? We have it all! And the best part is that you get to decide who goes home with 'honors' and who is left in the dust.  Speakers include:Jeannette Quirk, Matthew Quirk, Kevin Hogan, Amy Conlon

Subject: Plan 9 From Outer Space
Description: 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' After multiple attempts by the government to cover up alien sightings, the aliens decide execute plan 9 - resurrecting dead people as zombies - in an effort to push the government into acknowledging their existence.  Speakers include:

Subject: The Brain That Wouldn't Die
Description: 'The Brain That Wouldn't Die' Dr. Bill Cortner’s beautiful fiancee, Jan, is decapitated in a car accident. Bill cannot let her go, revives her head and keeps it in his laboratory while looking for a body that could serve as a host. Jan, however, has other plans!  Speakers include:

Subject: Lost Gems in Media
Description: Ever have someone tell you about a favorite TV series or book that you've never heard of, then you check it out and wonder why everyone *hasn't* heard of it?  Come share your favorite book/movie/TV show that you feel got less press than it deserved.    Speakers include:Derek Newland

Subject: Whedonites Unite! Trivia
Description: Brush up on your Whedonverse knowledge and join us for a rousing game of trivia based on the creations of the one and only! Buffy to Firefly, Dr. Horrible to Cabin in the Woods, Avengers to Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. Fabulous prizes await you!  Speakers include:Jennifer Beitzel

Subject: Script Writing for Movies
Description: Aching to write a script for that great movie idea that's been bouncing around in your head? Come get some tips and tricks for how to get started on writing a script.  Speakers include:Keith Martens, James Fernandez

Subject: Movie: Justice is Mind
Description: 'Justice Is Mind' In a future where MRI technology can read your mind, the trial of the century soon begins when a defendant faces his own memory for a double murder he doesn't remember committing.  Speakers include:Mark Lund

Subject: Of Gods, Heroes and Their Foes...
Description: Did you think 'Thor: The Dark World' was awful?  What would you like to see happen in 'X-Men: Days of Future Past'?  What would you have done differently regarding 'Captain America: Winter Solider'?  If these are questions you think about, then please join us for a rousing discussion of the movies and comics alike!   Interested in learning more about Marvel (and yes, DC) comics?  That's why we're here!  Note: there will be free comics and goodies giveaways!         Speakers include:Lucy Kitchen, Professor X

Subject: Fighting in the Movies - Chicks That Kick Ass
Description: Ever wonder if the action in films could happen in real life? Join us as we review and discuss some of the top female fighting scenes in cinema. We will watch movie clips and then examine the hand-to-hand techniques, “prop” fighting, and swordsmanship in each clip.  Speakers include:Shannon Marshall, Heather Gutterman, Mary Poirier, Caitlynn Poirier, Eva Galperin

Subject: Sound for Film and TV: SFX and More
Description: A detailed overview of the process of audio post production process, as presented by an audio editor. Touching on various topics such as sound effects, dialogue, mixing, music, the process difference between live action and animation, and other related areas.  Speakers include:Marla Kishimoto

Subject: Midnight Monster Movies with Dr. Bob: Behind the Lab Coat
Description: Ever wonder what went into making a midnight movie host show? Curious about how Dr. Bob Tesla and his crew came to be? Want to know why we did what did and didn't do what we didn't? This is your chance! A behind-the-scenes talk with the cast & crew of Midnight Monster Movies with Dr. Bob with Q&A.  Speakers include:Robert Gilbert, Melanie Gilbert, Christopher Shea Massie, Christina Alia Massie, Paul Gilliland

Subject: BoF: Recent Free Scifi Movies
Description: Movie making has become cheaper and easier. There are a number of fairly good quality amateur free movies/videos out there.  Which ones have you seen?  What did you like?  Speakers include:

Subject: Game Bangers: a D&D Parody Webseries
Description: Check out Game Bangers: The Webseries. A D&D Parody where table top gaming has been illegalized. Gamers must resort to underground gaming dens to play, while hiding from the police trying to bust them.  Speakers include:
